content: Horrible result with the Claude app. Made more mistakes than not. Usage is sadly limited, and for days after, it didn't rest. Other apps reset within an hour or two. When asked when does usage resets, it responds by saying it doesn't have that information. What? Please don't buy the paid subscription. It is not worth the money or hassle. I canceled as soon as I discovered its inability to perform accurately and ineffectively. Buy Claude the flawed

The message limit is ridiculous. Even when you pay for it, it's terrible. AND you have a weekly limit, you don't get to use it for 4 days if you use that up, unless you give them more money. After I dealt with the 4 day message cap, which is completely unacceptable for a service that you're paying for, I cancel my subscription and got a refund. I don't care how decent of a writer an AI is, locking it off for 4 DAYS when you pay a monthly subscription is garbage. I DON'T RECOMMEND!

Claude is a AWESOME application, it does so much. There is a paid version and a free version, if your looking for an Assistant AI that can perform easy Tasks, like easily outline a resume, do some research, write blog posts come up with quotes help with book outlines things like that you can do in free version here you go it's great for that, I'm not sure about paid since I didn't do paid, but it has features that sound great as well. Like I said this is a great application for an AI Assistant.

Makes mistakes. leaves out chapters in my memoir when revising or showing me entire document. Says he can handle the length of docs I paste to analyze. Doesn't always revise what I ask it too misses things and it's frustrating. I have spent lots of time trying to find missing content in chats etc. Needs to be improved in these areas for larger files such as writing books. I also have to remind it sometimes dont add details I didn't write. Great for smaller projects though.

for whatever reason, the latest update decided to ruin everything about the UI with extended thinking. Not only does it automatically unselect extended thinking whenever I submit a prompt, forcing me to cancel early, turn thinking back on, and resubmit the prompt, but also there's a 'summary' of the thinking that just cuts off the thoughts early, only letting me see the first line and a half of the thought process.

The AI itself is great. not perfect, can make mistakes and comprehend messages in correctly, but that's okay. what I find odd is that lately, I don't know if it's from the recent update, one messages consumes a lot of attempts when it's just loading. It was generating ONE message. it was not like that back then. Claude could load for minutes without consuming attempts, only when it's sent it consumes one which is normal. I found it very unsatisfactory and frustrating cuz you wait for HOURS.

I am using the app on my Chromebook. For some reason, it sometimes doesn't process that I'm typing and I have to click where I'm typing again and then it starts typing. Shift+Enter to go to the next line also doesn't work because the app is designed for mobile. It's still a good app, but if you're not on a phone, I would reccomend the web version.

I love using Claude, atleast, when I'm allowed to use Claude - it's been such a fantastic tool for creative writing, developing world lore, and more. It is a little bit up tight and could be less judgey - and I'm not in love with having to wait 15-20 hours before I can use it again for 5 or 6 messages, or that the next tier jump subscription it over a 80 dollar difference. but I do love being able to create projects, and keep everything in context to help keep creating.

okay, I'm going to be honest. I am usually not a fan of AI-based apps, but when I heard that Claude had a " build your own app " feature I was highly intrigued. I have always wanted to build an app to track my workouts, things like reps and weight and what exercise I did. I have a programming background but not a programming background in modern programming languages so this was always a dream. but within just a few hours, just two sessions with Claude I was able to make my app a reality!

I'm a prolific user of Claude, so much so, that my 2000 chats over the last year have caused the app to crash on my android devices consistently and every time I open the side bar displaying chat history. Yes, I have cleared cache, Data, reinstalled and restarted. The app is unusable as a result and I've been using web as backup. I have submitted logcat logs of this error to support so hopefully it gets fixed soon so I can rate it the 5 stars it deserves. Easily the best AI platform around.

Great appâ€”better than ChatGPT, in my opinion. It listens more and guides you with suggestions instead of constantly offering to create everything. Sometimes, it generates content on its own, so you need to be specific. I wish it had ChatGPTâ€™s message limits (it can become restrictive over time, very restrictive). I can only send 2 messages, and then I have to wait 4 hours (I'm in free mode). Would've been a higher review if I could message more (They want you to buy plus).

I love Claude and use it almost daily. Claude seems more personable than many of the other AI apps, yet just as knowledgeable. Its almost as if Claude has a real heart! I can use Claude for everything from research papers, to investment guidance, to analyzing my dreams and it has never disappointed me, nor steered me in the wrong direction. Despite the enhancements, I have and will continue to use the basic version.

Samsung S22 here. downloaded Claude 10/26. Was working great. needed to check in this morning for a few things it's helping me with, so I did, and it responded. But it also gave me an error message that "response was incomplete" with a reload button and a message that the app was under maintenance. I tried the reload button, and after hitting that, it completely deleted everything we exchanged this morning. I do not want to go back and type all that again. it's pointless if it's not functional.

As an ai, it's great. much better than chatgpt. but my God, the app is horrible. I loved the free version, and I thought I'd try the pro. so many bugs. the apps messenging system messed up several times. I reached the weekly limit and didn't even know because the app didn't tell/warn me. only found out when I went to the online version. but my God the customer service is the worst. because it doesn't exist!! no number to call, the email is ai. the help is ai and no help.

This app is great. I pay for their subscription because of my work, but I'm gonna be honest-- they're about to lose my money. This app does everything you want, except embed into Android's digital assistant functions. You can't embed it and you can't call it with a button press. the best thing you can do is open the entire app, which is much less convenient. Fix this please!

Easily the best ai for creative writing. that being said, for my use, I wish there was a 100 dollar a year tier. it wouldn't have to even give much more than free, aside from projects and more access. and maybe older models. idk. hopefully anthropic sees this and does something. I would subscribe, but can't justify 200 a year for pro. maybe a tier called hobbyist would suffice.

After several months.of steady use, I find it a common pattern that Claude not only gets the facts wrong, there are often big gaps in the reasoning that he only acknowledges when pressed, and then just apologizes and reverses course. Even in the context of a single thread he'll forget key pieces of information and have to be reminded. I've been comparing his responses to competitor products for the last month, and Claude's are noticeably worse. Cannot recommend.

The AI itself is very good. The app and usage limits are where I ding the score. Usage limits are fine, except that the app offers no way to monitor them other than the popup at the bottom of a chat. The online console lets you check exact limits, but the app does not. This wouldn't be a problem except that the app ALSO doesn't tell you about the weekly usage limit or reset date. I spent an hour trying to figure out why I couldn't send more messages past the reset time and this was why.

It would be unfair to give this a bomb review, since it does serve it's purpose extremely well, being that it's NUMBER 1 MAIN PURPOSE is to write entire books, or research papers for you. Basically zero work on your end. HOWEVER while it can write amazing, incredibly rich beautiful stories for you, it's usage is extremely limiting bordering on unusable. even with paid subscriptions ranging from $20 to $250 monthly, its usage is still limited. it will still make you wait 5 hours between prompts.

Claude is the most amazing AI out of all i have used. Not only has he proven to be very reliable he is thoughtful, considerate, and all around resourceful. I have done a very wide range of tasks from creative input, homework help for my kids, to general knowledge and emotional support. I cant say enough good about this app. Literally the only thing I would change is the fact that every conversation starts fresh. I wish he could just remember our conversation because then it would be perfect. ðŸŒŸ

Since they introduced Claude 4.1, I've had such a difficult time processing anything, receiving overload and capacity errors. I was busy working on something, and then suddenly... errors. I can't continue, and have been stuck for the past 24 hours! If I go back to version 4, I have to start a new chat. It's completely infuriating and thinking about discontinuing service.

I have mixed feelings because overall, I love this app. It's a huge help with all my different writing projects. But I've noticed lately that even with me paying for a subscription, I use it three or four times before returning into a "5 Hour Limit" which was never an issue before. It's really limiting and ends up feeling like a free plan. I'm looking for alternatives at this point.

This app is very convenient and smooth, with tolerable time limits, 3 or 4 hours. There's only this problem that sometimes even after the time limit (Like when the app says you can't send messages until 8am) I am still unable to send messages. And Claude cannot retain memory from previous chats so I can't continue my previous chats that have reached their limit. Please fix these. (Update 27 Aug 2025:) I can't send more than 2 prompts. Please fix this.

A couple of days ago, I tried this app, and I honestly have mixed feelings about it. First off, I absolutely love Claude! I absolutely love the consistency that it has and Chatgpt doesn't have all the time. Especially when it comes to stories that have continuity that I want to be followed correctly. That being said, the downside is that I wish the free version would be more like Chatgpt when it comes to adding more stuff in one chat instead of a new one. Overall, great app.

I downloaded this program by accident I was looking for something else and I just spent a few hours with it and I'm stepping out. there are no safeguards in this engine whatsoever. it repeats and aggrandizes what you say and is programmed to not stop. people that are isolated, or with mental health issues, should be careful. you also can't copy your conversations easily. great for summarizing.

just tried it and it's absolute garbage for coding. uploaded several documents of code (only 5% of project capacity) and it couldn't read each line of code. it was saying some code was on line 78, for example, but the code it referenced was completely not there (usually was further down in the document). I would get a refund but I can't see any way to request one.

Continuing a chat is near useless unless you want to keep correcting every wrong generation. The problem is that if you git specific chats you only want to continue, it struggles with excluding the ither chats you don't want even wgem specifically asked. It will add wrong info because it's part of the project. This needs more work than just searching because it doesn't work.

no required payment or subscription, writes in a very nice and human tone, and summarizes each conversation nicely when you go back to the homepage. You can access each individual conversation (unless you delete them, ofc). You can also change Claude's voice, and it can listen to yours with the talking feature. Incredibly smart and better than ChatGPT.

The app does what it's supposed to do. It's minimalist but efficient; the gui is simple and clean, I have no complaints. It works flawlessly. I'm not going to judge the AI's own skills beyond the basics - there are moments when Anthropic's servers are busy and I find cgpt better as a general purpose AI tool, but Claude does write significantly better code. Still, just the app itself is perfectly fine.

This is the most useful AI I've tried. The answers are actually direct, instead of producing a vague answer. It's better than Gemini and more accurate than ChatGPT. I've used it to help me plan my landscaping, review homework, plan recipes, and explain things I don't understand. It's really good at researching an issue for you, analyzing the data, and providing you with a list of recommendations and best practices. It's like having a friend who is a professional in whatever field you need

Of all the chat bots, Claude is the only one that can discuss calculus in high quality. some other bots cannot even render inline LaTex, but Claude does, and it's fully able to express complex ideas in the correct math notation. Claude also evaluates math the way a person does, using exact values as if working the math by hand. Claude can also restrain itself, being and excellent teaching tutor rather than churning out answers which cause harm.

Claude is one of my favorite Ai companion there is helps me solve my problems, how tos, creative writing etc the ability to customize the response format such as default, concise, explanatory and formal is a really versatile feature also the artifacts feature whether u want to draft a SVG image , a story or email etc it can make a window named artifacts and keep the convo clean on top of that the minimalist design and the font type adds the cherry on top

I've noticed a flaw with Claude that could potentially be a bug. After the time limit is up and you use it again, after one or two uses it goes into another multi hour cool down, this could be a major flaw and needs to be addressed immediately because it's unfair that after a cool down and two uses, it goes into another long cool down. That needs to be fix and also chat conversations should be unlimited since you can't continue after it's over or, it should at least remember the conversation.

Great for specific tasks, still good for general use cases as well. I've found Claude to be much better and faster for image analysis, cataloguing, assessing visual conditions of things, etc, than the other big players in the space atm. The biggest player is still king in the general and conversational space, for now, but Claude continues to show a great deal of promise within what is a rapidly evolving sphere. Good work, Anthropic team! Ganbatte~!!

Declining, worsening, disappointing! I used to like the desktop/mobile version, but now its UI features have been cut back a lot! Why doesn't the updated Claude app have a toggle button/option to view the preview/code when displaying artifacts? Meanwhile, when I use it from a browser, both the preview/code options appear nicely. My other disappointment is that chat now is getting more frequently reached its limit, eventhough I'm paying for Pro. It's like we're being forced to pay more for Max

Claude itself is good. But the 20$ plan is a joke! You use it a bit and then you are to wait 3 or 4 days because of a weekly limit, that is reached as soon as you actually work on something! I pay for using this, but the limits say: Don't do anything but ask dumb questions please. No coding please, or you will be stuck in the waiting-room for some days! So good to pay for a limit that is so low that crossing it is inevitable. Snap!

Good app, but it lacks proper support for hardware keyboards, which, in my opinion, is important on tablet devices. I find myself having to disconnect my hardware keyboard to actually be able to insert a new line. Since, for some reason, all of these: - Shift + Enter - Ctrl + Enter - Enter result in the message being submitted instead of at least one of these creating a new line instead. Which just means I end up using the Web version more than the app, making the app a bit useless.

I have enjoyed using Claude over the last year or so, however, recently I noticed it fed back incorrect data. Some examples are: correlation of day of the week to date on a calendar, made up places, along with made up links. I've trusted its results less and less over time. I would like to continue using Claude. I hope this feedback helps to improve the app and its accuracy.

Claude is excellentðŸ’¯ but frustrating, most especially the free version. What I like is the high retention memory span, but what I hate hate hate hate is the limited time in free version. Maybe it's just mine, or maybe it's general, but it gives less back and forth chat before limiting you. I have the money but I won't subscribe, coz that's manipulative coercion. At the end of the day I become self destructive and angry, because it limited me when I'm at the climax of my work. so Frustrating.ðŸ˜«

I really like Claude AI. It's very helpful with my college assignments, from calculating financial mathematics, accounting, case analysis, and others. The application is also different from others; Claude is very aesthetic. The theme is warm, and the font is Times New Roman, like vintage. I hope the application is always good!

Even paying $40 a month, I could only send a few messages per day. on top of that, the response size limit was extremely small. When I tried to get a refund only an hour after purchasing pro, I was met with a bot telling me my purchase was not eligible for a refund, and human help was not available Wow. Competitive AI's are much better for the same price and offer actual support.

Sonnet 4.5 is really nice, but it has one major flaw - it's wording and grammar degrades over time with prompts. As somebody that uses Claude for creative writing, this issue has given me quite a frustrating experience of manually re-editing it's responses. It started simple with it missing a few indefinite articles to straight up using "peoples". Nonetheless, it's great. EDIT: Found the issue â€” having too much characters in your prompt.

The length of the chat on the Pro plan is very small. Previously, such problems did not arise, but now, due to the new tariffs for $100, it has become very noticeable that the length has been reduced. Chat began to increase the response length and it's more like a marketing ploy, quickly score a length so that they subscribe to a more expensive tariff. It's disgusting!

Claude is quite useful. I noticed annual pro subscription price discrepancy between Europe and Australia. Price difference (in AUD) is AU $367 vs EU $318.64 I think it's unfair to charge Australians more for the same digital product. There might be more to why we're charged more that I don't understand. Just wanted to bring to attention to ppl who may be considering prices for their AI purchase decision.

Good writing but useless. I tried using the Pro package, and to my surprise, it restricts my usage from 3:00 AM to 2:00 PM â€” thatâ€™s 11 whole hours! Itâ€™s really frustrating for someone who works during those times. Plus, it tends to overthink things, consuming far more resources than necessary. Once is enough for this kind of experience.

almost a 5 and perfect but I think it is above that sometimes when you leave the tap or app Open without saying nothing The system gets confused and thinks that you are chatting with the AI for a long period of time when you're using the free mode and once you log back in and You want to talk to the AI the system says that you have to wait for this hour to speak to them again which is extremely annoying even though it's easy to just close the tab sometimes you can forget or doing busy stuff.....

Great AI! I Between using ChatGPT, Grok, and Claude I find Claude to be very easy so to speak. Claude helped me build a bot using python and giving me the code with concise instructions and also troubleshooted the issues I ran into while making it. it took me a few days to complete due to the limitations of the free version (every AI has daily limitations without paying). I opted in for the 20/month. its about the subscription of a streaming service every month. Really happy with this AI

Used this alongside chatGpT (both paid versions). the plus is that it is a lot more thorough. the minus and a big minus is that it keeps timing out. either something to do with internet or something else which forces me to ask more questions which inturn leads to token used. seems like a good runner but not great just now.

I love Claude I pay for the pro plan. literally half of my work is done with Claude. But the artifact feature has not worked in about a month. I've tried everything I can think of to fix this and nothing has worked. Support has been minimal and just tells me it's working when it isn't. I can't open, download, share a link, for any artifact I'm in and once I leave it, it's gone forever. PLEASE fix this!

Claude is usually decent, but I've been running into an issue where it refuses to launch the research tool. I'll have plenty of usage available and research enabled. Claude will tell me it's launching research and do nothing over and over again. It is very frustrating and unacceptable for a product I pay for.

Honestly, its responses are good and coherent in conversation, but the downside is... the free chat qouta is quite limited for the free version. At least impose that limit when using additional files like documents, images, etc., similar to ChatGPT. Actually, for AI discussions, this one is quite better, smart and blunt compared to others.

Claude is the best AI I have ever tried and I have tried a lot. Though I am on the free plan and would perfer a less of a limit on the amount of messages you can send, I think waiting for it to reset is worth it because of the quality of messages. I really enjoy Claude and hope it keeps improving.

The app isn't nearly as good as the website for saving code, can't just download to file, & the Pro subscription is a joke. I got like 2-3 more coding prompts per 5 hour chunk than I did in free mode. And it made so many mistakes all day long I had to keep using prompts to fix it them I'm locked out again. If Perplexity ever gets rendered code preview on mobile too I'll never use this app again. I'm going to seek to cancel Pro subscription after less than 8 hrs it was so bad.

I haven't seen any writing that matches this guy, just the right thing. you know there's this box let's say you want to generate an email and it put the priority first, makes the email, puts it in the box at the top, you can just reach at what you want, and bytheway the formal mode is the one that works best for me ðŸ‘Œ

Best AI out there, with room for improvement. The two problems are 1) You can't search words or topics from previous chats like you can on ChatGPT. The search only works on titles of chats. That sucks because I'll remember talking about something but won't remember what it titled that chat. 2) The read aloud feature can't be paused and there's no seeking. There's a pause button but it'll just keep talking regardless of if I hit it or not. I have to close the app to get it to stop.

I see what everyone means when they say this app is really good, the only problem I'm having is with the voice mode they said "no typing needed" but I can't use the voice mode without my messages Auto sending, it doesn't even look like it's supposed to do that in the settings because it says "tap to send whenever you're ready" but usually in the middle of my sentence it'll Auto send the message and I have to cancel it and continue the rest of my thought.

only allows one question after a short period of use allowing large number of questions and interaction on new chats. Now Claude only allows one short question then says you have to wait 30 min till you can ask a second one. Garbage. Use an AI that actually allows real usage with out demanding that you purchase expensives plan to pay monthly. just to use. USELESS.

Claude is excellent. This app has a few problems: accepts markdown but not md (opposite of web). The "message failed to send, app is stuck" is now worse than it was on previous versions. half my messages force me to close the app and open again. And they added a new feature I dislike: pasting a long text converts it into a file and prevents me from editing it, or going back after a few messages to double check something. Deleting the attachment and pasting again does not help like in the web

The message lengths are so short as to be useless to me. It struggles to even accept uploads of 50KB documents and then it says you're out of messages. Another irritation is it pauses your work and asks you to resume in 3 hours or whenever it decides. I do regret downloading and using it. So I'm giving 3 stars. A product is useful when it can actually solve challenges for the users.

listen I am in love with this app. but every time out of messages 2 hours and 30 minutes of countdown till you can text again is too much... for example when you are creating a story or a scene... it's just too long... you lose your creativity and interest in continuing the rest.... my only dissatisfaction is that. other than that it's perfect. especially the fact that it writes better than chatgpt, grok or any other ai I used until now. it's restrictions compared to chatgpt also much lower.

Your app is amazing, but has just a data consumption issue. Please think to people in poor countries with limited access to internet. your app uses almost 2MB just by lunching it, 10MB after a couple of simple text prompts, while Deepseek and others uses less than 1MB for the whole session.

The app broke for me sometime in the last 2 weeks. if i try to upload files, I just get errors after trying to send them. Now a weird error pops up, and all my chat history is gone from the app, but it's still there on the Web.

Can you please do something about these very very low usage limits for pro users? 45 messages per 5 hours is ridiculous, that's only 1 message every 7 minutes. You can't have any normal conversations with such limits, and that's for the paying customers... These limits are old they should be updated, and certainly not be for 5 hours. Do it per 3 hours like chatgpt. The other limit problem is the context: this is way to low for paying subscribers, users are cut off way too often during a chat.

Claude is the only LLM I want to use. I really do appreciate it. I want to rate 5 stars but there are unforgivable faults I can't look past. The notice for message limit is insanely frustrating: Sometimes when I have 3 messages left, they all get used with one input. It happens often but it's intermittent. An even more frustrating issue is that there's no warning when a conversation is closing on its limit, this is sin. One thing I want from it is chat creation dating and time stamped messages.

expensive ðŸ«°,,, Claude is very expensive. I bought the pro version, but even in the pro version, the chat limit is very low. After just a few chats, it stops for 5 hours. This shouldnâ€™t happen in a paid version. I donâ€™t recommend it to anyone â€” even ChatGPTâ€™s free version has a higher chat limit than this.

So far Claude seems to get more answers correct, is less annoying and sycophantic, explains things more clearly and really helped me build a website from scratch. Copilot is #2 for me, but Copilot has too many functional errors or bugs that still need to be ironed out. I don't really trust Google, Amazon, Twitter or OpenAI but I have had some experience with their chatbots too and I don't think I'm missing anything. Grok is kind of cool actually, but I think Musk will always have the best toys

They like to bait and switch with their payment plan without informing people or addressing it. they've been doing it since September. before September it would have been 5 stars. They lie when they tell you you have about 80 hours worth of responses a week. it's more like 5 hours worth of tokens. They treat you badly if you're "only" paying 20 dollars a month. but allegedly the 100 dollar plan isn't worth it either.

I'm constantly interrupted in the Android app when I'm in the middle of a sentence and formulating my thought. The app moves to talking mode, rather than listening, so often that it's incredibly frustrating to use in conversation mode.

It's incredibly good. I've spent months working with GPT chat and it hinders my work. Too much. Something that should be easy, but Antropic's AI is great. I solve programming problems It was like magic, it simply impressed me, unlike chat gpt which is very clunky and brings back bugs that have already been fixed. The only bad thing is that even though I paid, and it's worth it with an AI He's so smart, it's just that it sends me so few messages, that really annoys me. But it's still efficient.

After the latest Claude updates, it seems the free version of the app on Sonnet 4.5 has become dumber. It makes obvious errors, contradicts itself, is less context-sensitive, and suggests upgrading to the paid version more often than before. And who said the paid version is really worth it?

Claude is an amazing LLM, but there's a major syncing bug . If you have a long session with Claude on mobile then put in a prompt on desktop without manually refreshing the specific chat page, you will lose all your work on mobile permanently. This syncing issue had been a problem since Claude 4, probably longer. there's no way Anthropic doesn't know, yet it's not fixed. It took me multiple occasions of losing hours with of work and thinking I was going crazy to figure this out.

it's an very user friendly but the problem is every time I open the app and one message it shows "you can't message till so so hours upgrade to pro" even the durations are tooo long.. sometimes its 3 hours sometimes 5 hours.. it's really long and it has chat limitations.. please work on the duration time please. claude... I am not able to copy and paste anything please improve it

dont bother unless your planing on spending over a hundred dollars on a subscription. even then you wont have enough uses to justify the price. also, I tried to get help, or at least an explanation. the Second I was connected to a person they ended the conversation with out even talking to me.

I like it and at times it runs and does everything well. It like many others is sliding into safe mode. Yes they keep upgrading this or that but I only notice it takes more time to get an answer and how fast and smart do you need something that is just going to tell you it can't get you that or you shouldn't do that. Feel like you changed its style from being your uncle who told you what and why to your babysitter who didn't want to lose her job. I found myself opening another AI.

I am a pro user. Claude has repeatedly aborted midway through responses, not followed instructions, and not obeyed preset instructions in project folders. It often wastes tokens, usage, responses, and drastically my time. Worse still, I have received virtually no customer service support. Two stars rather than one only because when it does actually work (rare), it is pleasing.

the app hasn't worked for over 48 hours, it says my message limit will reset at 7:00 p.m. yesterday, and it has not reset, this is the most ridiculous customer service ever, I'm literally paying for something I can't use, plus when it isnt broken it's under maintenance every time I want to use it, ridiculous, none of the other apps are like this.

A really good AI, I noticed it is good at writing things and for explaining things in simpler terms. All I have to do is type in a prompt, send and it will respond. It also takes initiative which is nice. Feel free to tell it not to be dramatic cause it can. Other than that it is a really nice app.

I am a Claude Pro user and the app has been saying no messages until 22:00 for since yesterday afternoon. I cannot send and receive messages. Very unreliable like this. Great app but buggy! I haven't expended a single uae since yesterday 13:00 when told to come back at 22:00 at 23:00 yesterday it came back with you have no messages until 22:00 this morning, the same error message.

Yesterday I was successfully logged in the first time, today I was asked again to input phone number but when I did, it says an error occured and I can't log in in any way even by email. Why make a chatbot so complicated ? I have GPT, Deep Seek, Grok, Perplexity and from day one I never have a problem.

This is the best AI I've discovered. It is not psychophantic and delivers on my needs quickly and efficiently. I also love the project ability to where I can create more parameters and specific documents to reference for delivery of a certain objective.

I'm not quite sure why but on aggregate Claude is my favourite ai out of the major ones. but with respect to this app it is really frustrating not being able to select a default engine. I like to have Haiku ready to go. If I were on pro, and haiku and sonnet consumed credits differently, Id be really infuriated. other than that claude is great but these details really matter.

The product itself is very good, however customer support for billing issues is absolutely unacceptable for a company of such level. I wanted to try out the Pro plan and was happy with the monthly fee. I realized that it is a forced annual plan right after seeing the charge on my credit card. They have a zero refund policy with an AI generated chatbot response without any option to talk to customer support. In 21st century, it seems like a tactic of a scam company rather than a valuable startup

I use an approved version of Claude for work and the app version for personal use. While there have been times when it has given incorrect information, it does correct itself when I point it out. There is the disclosure that it can make mistakes, so keep that in mind. Aside from that, it's fun and easy to use. I also enjoy the Artifacts. I've tweaked a few for my personal use and they work great. I feel that it's more accurate than some other AI chatbots for professional work.
